conclusion: Acceleration is defined as the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Acceleration can be expressed as a = Δv/Δt.
At t = 1 second, the velocity v is 2 m/s.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity v is -2 m/s.
Calculate the change in velocity Δv = -2 m/s - 2 m/s = -4 m/s.
Determine the time interval Δt = 3 s - 1 s = 2 s.
Calculate the acceleration a = Δv/Δt = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s².
The acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds is -2 m/s².
